name: Futurice status page
body:
### Transparency brings in goodness

Check out [our public status page](http://status.beta.futurice.com). We published the source code so you can do that too. It's all open source, and published with MIT/BSD/GPL [licenses](https://github.com/ojarva/status.futurice.com/blob/master/LICENSE.md). 

Unfortunately due to nature of the site, installation is rather complicated and requires multiple steps. [README file](https://github.com/ojarva/status.futurice.com/blob/master/README.md) gives some instructions, but that's probably not enough.

If you encounter problems with code provided by Futurice, feel free to send email to me ([olli.jarva@futurice.com](mailto:olli.jarva@futurice.com)), and I'll do my best to help you. I can't provide any help with general configuration issues (for example, how to configure apache2, or how to setup server in general). I recommend using [superuser.com](http://superuser.com/) for admin issues and [stackoverflow.com](http://stackoverflow.com/) for programming issues.

### Who are we?

This code is provided by [Futurice](http://www.futurice.com), small software company with five offices around the Europe, and about 150 employees. You can also find us on [twitter](http://www.twitter.com/futurice) and [facebook](http://www.facebook.com/futurice/).
note: Don't delete this file! It's used internally to help with page regeneration.
